content.description: Start climbing up the crack/seam while clipping bolts on your left. Crux is after the third bolt. Continue up excellent rock to the top.
content.location: Located on the left side of the west face of South Dome.

content.description:
A fun link-up/extension that climbs

Wanna Get High?

, clips the anchors and moves right to finish with the steep upper section of

Kenny McCormick Memorial Route

.
content.protection:
7 bolts, anchors

It's best to clip the anchors on

Wanna Get High?

with a long draw or sling to cut down on any potential rope drag.
content.location:
Starts on

Wanna Get High?

and finishes on

Kenny McCormick Memorial Route

.

climbs.name: Wanna Get High?
climbs.fa: Chris Miller and Adam Stackhouse, April 2020

content.description:
Fun climbing up a slippery, slabby apron gains the base of a vertical headwall and a distinct crux past the 3rd bolt; higher another slabby section is encountered before the anchors.

Clip the anchors and head right to finish with the upper section of

Kenny McCormick Memorial Route

for a slightly harder variation -

Wanna Get Higher?

(5.10a).
content.location: Leftmost route on the south face and on the left margin of a grey patina shield.

climbs.name: Towelie Ban
climbs.fa: Chris Miller and Adam Stackhouse, April 2020

content.description:
A boulder start on polished rock reaches a horizontal crack and the end of the difficulties. Continue up past a bush and enjoy the plentiful holds and high quality rock.

This route and

Southern Comfort

are directly across from

Friendly Faces

.
content.protection:
TR from anchors atop

Southern Comfort

.
content.location:
Start off a wedged boulder 10 feet right of

Southern Comfort

.

content.description: Slippery feet at the start. Fun climbing on excellent holds. After last bolt, move left to the anchor. Shared anchor.
content.protection: 5 bolts to mussy hook anchor, lower off.
content.location: On the right side of the east face of South Dome. This route starts on the same upper ledge as the routes on the Friendly Faces. Scramble around the right side of some boulders to access this upper area.

climbs.name: Kenny McCormick Memorial Route
climbs.fa: Reed Ames, Kyle Campbell. March 2020. GU.

content.description: Fun climbing on mostly good rock. There is a lower and upper crux that can both be avoided by climbing slightly right of the bolts. You can also climb straight through the bolts which keeps the grade at a solid 10b.Â  Shares anchor with Southern Comfort.
content.protection: Bolts, Mussy hook anchor. Shares anchor with Southern Comfort.
content.location: Located on the southeast side of South Dome. Starts a few feet to the right of Wanna Get High.

content.description: This is a top rope route that can be climbed after climbing KMMR or Southern Comfort. It is the line that is directly below the anchor and covers the ground in-between the two bolted lines.
content.location: Starts a few feet to the left of Southern Comfort. Can be top roped after climbing either of its neighboring routes.
